[GRAMMAR]: "he woulded come back" should be "he would come back"
[SYNTAX]: some sentences are long and convoluted

[LOGIC]: the transition between Debby's emotions and actions could be smoother
[STRUCTURE]: the narrative jumps between past and present without clear connections
[CLARITY]: some sentences are wordy and hard to follow

[GRAMMAR]: incorrect verb conjugation ("Debby have suffered" instead of "Debby had suffered")
[LEXICON]: informal language ("'tis not like I'd forget Jack" instead of a more formal alternative)

[LOGIC]: abrupt transition between Debby's thoughts and the description of the town
[STRUCTURE]: lengthy and detailed descriptions that disrupt the flow of the narrative
[CLARITY]: unclear motivations behind some characters' actions (e.g., Mrs. Lane's sudden harshness)
